channel.title: Adding animation
channel.description: How do I add the animation from scratch, Well what I want to know is what files do I need to edit, and an idea on what to do. Thanks if you help.

item.title: Adding animation
item.dc:creator: @bjc22 bjc22
item.description:
@bjc22 wrote:

Thank you guys for helping, But it has no errors, but it just doesn’t work in the game. Am I missing something?

Read full topic

item.title: Adding animation
item.dc:creator: @legend_rene legend rene
item.description:
@legend_rene wrote:

public void setAnimation(int i) { pEmote = i; updateRequired = true; appearanceUpdateRequired = true; startAnimation(i); } public void resetAnimation() { pEmote = playerSE; updateRequired = true; appearanceUpdateRequired = true; }
Add those and you can use pEmote , startAnimation , and setAnimation , and resetAnimation.

Read full topic

item.title: Adding animation
item.dc:creator: @PkLite PkLite
item.description:
@PkLite wrote:

I’m not centering everything. I’m centering my codes.

Read full topic

item.title: Adding animation
item.dc:creator: @legend_rene legend rene
item.description:
@legend_rene wrote:

[quote=“Eh Pretty Easy, post:11, topic:141440”][quote author=PkLite link=topic=193705.msg1740962#msg1740962 date=1189289169]
You need a list of the animation identifications. You then need to add a void. The void could look something like this.

[center]public void animaxe() { showAnimation(0000); }[/center]

You would need to change the animation identification. You then need to link the void to something. If you wanted to add it to a command. You would use this command.

[center]if(command.equals("animaxe")) { animaxe(); }[/center]

If you would like to use the animation with a weapon. You would just use the animation part.

[center]showAnimation(0000);[/center]
[/quote]You know, centering everything makes you look like a fucking retard, also; it’s not a void, it’s a method.[/quote]
With or without a returntype?

Read full topic

item.title: Adding animation

item.description:
@PkLite wrote:

Try using.

[center]setAnimation(855);[/center]

Or.

[center]setAnim(855);[/center]

case 168: // yes emote animation(855); break;

No errors, But when I click on the yes button, It doesn’t do anything.

item.title: Adding animation
item.dc:creator: @Eh_Pretty_Easy Eh Pretty Easy
item.description:
@Eh_Pretty_Easy wrote:

[quote=“PkLite, post:6, topic:141440”]You need a list of the animation identifications. You then need to add a void. The void could look something like this.

[center]public void animaxe() { showAnimation(0000); }[/center]

You would need to change the animation identification. You then need to link the void to something. If you wanted to add it to a command. You would use this command.

[center]if(command.equals("animaxe")) { animaxe(); }[/center]

If you would like to use the animation with a weapon. You would just use the animation part.

[center]showAnimation(0000);[/center][/quote]You know, centering everything makes you look like a fucking retard, also; it’s not a void, it’s a method.

Read full topic

item.title: Adding animation
item.dc:creator: @zammy1 zammy!!
item.description:
@zammy1 wrote:

	public void animation(int i)
	{
		if(emoteTimer > 0)
		{
			pEmote = i;
			callUpdates();
		}
	}
	public void callUpdates()
	{
		updateRequired = true;
		appearanceUpdateRequired = true;
	}
		if(emoteTimer > 0)
		{
			emoteTimer--;
		}
		if(emoteTimer <= 0)
		{
			emoteTimer = 0;
			resetAnimation();
			callUpdates();
		}
	public void resetAnimation()
	{
		pEmote = playerSE;
		callUpdates();
	}
public int emoteTimer = 0;

client.java 

public int pEmote = 0x328;

player.java

that should work

Read full topic

item.title: Adding animation
item.dc:creator: @PkLite PkLite
item.description:
@PkLite wrote:

You need a list of the animation identifications. You then need to add a void. The void could look something like this.

[center]public void animaxe() { showAnimation(0000); }[/center]

You would need to change the animation identification. You then need to link the void to something. If you wanted to add it to a command. You would use this command.

[center]if(command.equals("animaxe")) { animaxe(); }[/center]

If you would like to use the animation with a weapon. You would just use the animation part.

[center]showAnimation(0000);[/center]

Read full topic
